required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial of TQC3721 Suspension for Inhalation
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetic Characteristics, and Primary Efficacy of TQC3721 Suspension for Inhalation

lead_sponsor.agency: Chia Tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Chia Tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetic characteristics of TQC3721 suspension for inhalation in single/multiple administration(s) in healthy subjects; to evaluate the safety,tolerability and efficacy TQC3721 suspension for inhalation in multiple administrations in patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease（COPD）and asthma.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment of the subjects to 72 hours after the last administration
primary_outcome.description: The Number of adverse events as assessed by Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v5.0

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment of the subjects to 72 hours after the last administration
primary_outcome.description: The Incidence of adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v5.0

primary_outcome.measure: Number of adverse events related to the study drug
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment of the subjects to 72 hours after the last administration
primary_outcome.description: The number of adverse events associated with the study drug assessed by CTCAE V5.0

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events associated with the study drug
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment of the subjects to 72 hours after the last administration
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of adverse events associated with the study drug as assessed by CTCAE V5.0

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 60 minutes before each administration, to 72 hours after administration
Within 60 minutes before each administration, to 72 hours after administration
Within 60 minutes before each administration, to 72 hours after administration
primary_outcome.description: Time to maximum concentration following drug administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 60 minutes before each administration, to 72 hours after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent terminal elimination half-life following drug administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 60 minutes before each administration, to 72 hours after administration
Within 60 minutes before each administration, to 72 hours after administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Forced Expiratory Volume in the first second (FEV1) for patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease（COPD） or asthma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before administration to 3 hours after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Change From Baseline in Peak FEV1 (Over 3 Hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline FEV1 to Morning Trough FEV1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment of the subjects to to 72 hours after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Change From Baseline FEV1 to Morning Trough FEV1

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline FEV1 to Average FEV1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment of the subjects to to 72 hours after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Change From Baseline FEV1 to Average FEV1

secondary_outcome.measure: COPD Assessment Test (CAT) for patients with COPD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 4 weeks after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Change From Baseline in COPD Assessment Test (CAT) Scoring at Week 4.The score range is 0 to 40 (0 to 10 is minor influence;11 to 20 is moderate; 21 to30 is severe;31 to 40 is very severe), and more than 10 indicates more symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified medical research council(mMRC) for patients with COPD or asthma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 4 weeks after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Change From Baseline in mMRC Scoring at Week 4.The severity is measured on a five-point scale from 0 to 4, with a higher score indicating more severe respiratory distress.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive 0.2 mg/1.0 mg/3.0 mg/6.0 mg/12.0 mg/24.0 mg single dose of TQC3721 suspension for inhalation on Day 1.
Participants will receive 0mg single dose of TQC3721 suspension placebo for inhalation on Day 1.

intervention.description: Participants will receive 0.2 mg/1.0 mg/3.0 mg/6.0 mg/12.0 mg/24.0 mg single dose of TQC3721 suspension for inhalation.
Participants will receive 0mg single dose of TQC3721 suspension placebo for inhalation .

facility.name: West China Hospital of Sichuan University
